isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 25-SI SERIES, TYPES 400 AND 450 - TROUBLESHOOTING - RATED VOLTAGE

svcprocinfo.para: Preferably, alternator output should be checked at the "Rated Voltage" given in Table 1. However, it is permissible to check the output in amperes at any voltage within the "Operating Range" listed in the table, since the current output will be quite close to the value that would be obtained at "Rated Voltage." The voltage should never be allowed to rise above the Operating Range for any length of time.

svcsubproc.title: Table 1
svcsubproc.para: It should be noted that the voltage may be below the "Operating Range" if the battery is in a low state of charge. However, as the battery receives a charge, the voltage will rise to some value within the "Operating Range."
Trouble in the vehicle charging system will be indicated by one of two conditions:

item.para: An undercharged battery as evidenced by low specific gravity readings and slow cranking.
An overcharged battery as evidenced by excessive battery water usage.

svcsubproc.para: These conditions can be caused by:

item.para: Since the battery may have an internal defect, it must be checked to determine its condition. Refer to the Group 08, BATTERY section of the Service Manual for battery test procedure.

Poor circuit connections in the charging system can cause an undercharged condition only. Carefully inspect all connections including grounds between the alternator and battery for cleanliness and tightness. Insure that the battery cable clamps are clean and tight and that the battery is dry and clean.

If the battery and circuit connection checks are satisfactory, the alternator assembly must be checked on the vehicle by making connections as shown in Figure 4. Remember that hex bolt on output terminal is electrically insulated. Assemble a closed end terminal clip with 1/2 in. (12.7 mm) hole to output terminal; then connect ammeter lead clip to this terminal clip.

svcsubproc.para: With test equipment connected as shown in Figure 4, follow this procedure:

step1.para: With all accessories and the carbon pile turned off, increase engine speed as required to obtain maximum voltage reading.

If voltage exceeds 15 volts on a 12-volt system, 30 volts on a 24-volt system or 39 volts on a 32-volt system, remove alternator for repair as covered under
REPAIR PROCEDURES
, in this section.
If voltage does not exceed 15 volts on a 12-volt system, 30 volts on a 24-volt system or 39 volts on a 32-volt system, proceed as follows:

step2.para: Insure that accessories have not been left on for an extended period.
Check the drive belt for proper tension.
Inspect the wiring for defects. Check all connections for tightness and cleanliness, including the cable clamps and battery posts.
Connect a voltmeter from "Output" terminal on alternator to ground. A zero reading indicates an open between voltmeter connection and battery.

step1.para: If previous steps check satisfactorily, check alternator as follows:

step2.para: Connect an ammeter in the circuit at the "Output" terminal of alternator.
Turn on accessories. Connect the carbon pile across the battery.
Operate engine at moderate speed as required, usually 4000 alternator rpm or more and adjust carbon pile as required to obtain maximum current output.

important.para: Initial voltage buildup is by residual magnetism in rotor. Increase the speed as required to obtain maximum current output.

step2.para: If ampere output is not within 10 amperes of rated output as stamped on alternator frame, remove alternator for repair If ampere output is within 10 amperes of rated output as stamped on alternator frame, alternator is not defective. In this case, an adjustment of the voltage setting may correct the condition.

step1.para: Adjust voltage setting as outlined below:

step2.para: Scrape silicone rubber coating from potentiometer to expose slotted screw ( Figure 5).

figure.caption: Voltage Setting Adjustment (Silastic Coating Not Shown on Regulator)

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. LOCATE LEAD MIDWAY BETWEEN TRANSISTOR PINGS

step2.para: Turn slotted screw clockwise to increase voltage setting or counterclockwise to decrease voltage setting.

step1.para: After adjusting voltage setting check for an improved battery condition over a service period of reasonable length. If adjusting the setting does not correct the battery condition, remove the alternator for repair.

svcsubproc.para: Remember that if the battery state of charge is low, the regulator may not be limiting the voltage, and turning the adjusting screw will show no change on the voltmeter. However, turning the adjusting screw will change the voltage setting to a new value which will be indicated by the voltmeter when the battery state of charge increases.
